bug.author: cyrilthank
bug.summary: * spec.validation.openAPIV3Schema.properties[spec].type: Required value: must not be empty for specified object fields; with Kubernetes 1.16
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] Executed the workaround in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3810#issuecomment-527687504>#3810 (comment)</denchmark-link>
get errors like the below no matches for kind "deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1" error: unable to recognize "STDIN": no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "apps/v1beta2" What did you expect to happen: all the pods to show up in kubectl get pods -n kubeflow Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.]
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: (use kfctl version): kfctl v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T11:13:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T11:05:50Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): NAME="Ubuntu" VERSION="18.04.3 LTS (Bionic Beaver)" ID=ubuntu ID_LIKE=debian PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS" VERSION_ID="18.04" HOME_URL="<denchmark-link:https://www.ubuntu.com/>https://www.ubuntu.com/</denchmark-link> " SUPPORT_URL="<denchmark-link:https://help.ubuntu.com/>https://help.ubuntu.com/</denchmark-link> " BUG_REPORT_URL="<denchmark-link:https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/>https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/</denchmark-link> " PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="<denchmark-link:https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy>https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy</denchmark-link> " VERSION_CODENAME=bionic UBUNTU_CODENAME=bionic

kubeflow@masternode:/nfsroot/kf-poc$ kubectl get nodes NAME STATUS ROLES AGE VERSION kubeflowslavenode1.com Ready 21h v1.16.0 masternode.com Ready master 21h v1.16.0

Moving here to not disrupt the helm issue anymore, It seems you also need to add a missing "selector" field to the spec field to fix the missing required field "selector" in io.k8s.api.apps.v1.DeploymentSpec errors. <denchmark-code>spec: selector: matchLabels: app: yourapp name: yourname </denchmark-code>
Replace app and name values with whatever kubeflow wants, should be something like this: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6374#issuecomment-533840097>helm/helm#6374 (comment)</denchmark-link>
or this: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6374#issuecomment-533185074>helm/helm#6374 (comment)</denchmark-link>
Just check whatever deployments are failing and edit manually the files Cant help with the openAPIV3Schema errors üòû

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jabbo16>@Jabbo16</denchmark-link> for your patient replies Can you please advise where/how to obtain the yaml files referenced in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6374#issuecomment-533840097>helm/helm#6374 (comment)</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6374#issuecomment-533185074>helm/helm#6374 (comment)</denchmark-link>

The yaml files referenced there are related to installing tiller, that suffers the same api deprecation issues with k8s 1.16.0. You need to check your kubeflow deployment yaml files (I guess they are inside the kustomize folder) and manually add the selector field in the similar way of how it was also needed to be added to the tiller deployment yaml to work with latest k8s version. Just use that fixed deployment file as an example to edit your kubeflow ones.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link>
Try to check this requirement:
spec.selector has to match labels of spec.template.metadata.labels
source: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53304461/error-selector-does-not-match-template-labels>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53304461/error-selector-does-not-match-template-labels</denchmark-link>
Thank you <denchmark-link:https://github.com/uniuuu>@uniuuu</denchmark-link> can you please advise what i could do to unblock and move forward with the kubeflow poc?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link>
I can see from the first post: Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", After which step you upgraded k8s to 1.16.0 ? Could you post a full script of how to reproduce problem. I might catch on then to get root cause.

for the file "./suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-service.yaml" i did the below apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: name: katib-suggestion-bayesianoptimization selector: matchLabels: app: katib component: suggestion-bayesianoptimization spec: type: ClusterIP ports:

"./suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml" i did the below apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: katib-suggestion-bayesianoptimization selector: matchLabels: app: katib component: suggestion-bayesianoptimization spec: replicas: 1 template: metadata: name: katib-suggestion-bayesianoptimization selector: matchLabels: app: katib component: suggestion-bayesianoptimization spec: containers:

suggestion-bayesianoptimization-service-and -deployment.zip
Check with this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/katib-v1alpha1/suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/katib-v1alpha1/suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml</denchmark-link>
Delete spec.template.metadata.selector Delete metadata.selector Leave only one selector and under spec.selector I suppose you have to have also spec.template.labels defined and selector should match the label name. Check if your on the latest commit. This one <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/commit/0842eb2b97f433bd39f1dc1882cf833cefa6c68f>kubeflow/manifests@0842eb2</denchmark-link>
provides fix for compatibility issue.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/3670104/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.zip>suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.zip</denchmark-link>
can you please confirm if this modified file is ok requesting since i am getting the below message configmap/metrics-collector-template unchanged 2019/09/30 09:35:28 got file 'suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml', but '/nfsroot/kf-poc/kustomize/suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml' must be a directory to be a root Error: accumulating resources: recursed accumulation of path 'base': accumulating resources: accumulating resources from 'suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml': YAML file [suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml] encounters a format error. error converting YAML to JSON: yaml: line 5: mapping values are not allowed in this context error: no objects passed to apply customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/notebooks.kubeflow.org configured though <denchmark-link:https://codebeautify.org/yaml-validator>https://codebeautify.org/yaml-validator</denchmark-link> returns it as valid yaml

Please pull latest commit from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests</denchmark-link>
This is file you need <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/0842eb2b97f433bd39f1dc1882cf833cefa6c68f/katib-v1alpha2/suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/0842eb2b97f433bd39f1dc1882cf833cefa6c68f/katib-v1alpha2/suggestion/base/suggestion-bayesianoptimization-deployment.yaml</denchmark-link>
But changes were done in many others.

You can see the errors are from another deployments katib-suggestion-grid, katib-suggestion-hyperband, katib-suggestion-nasrl, katib-suggestion-random. Now I see from <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link> you apply <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.6.2.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.6.2.yaml</denchmark-link> which uses repo manifests <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests</denchmark-link>
That's mean that there has to be a new release of kubeflow or so for k8s v1.16 If you need to have it done without waiting try to reinstall kubeflow from source code if you can. You can also try to apply the rest of files from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/master/katib-v1alpha2/suggestion/base>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/master/katib-v1alpha2/suggestion/base</denchmark-link> but you can see from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/commit/0842eb2b97f433bd39f1dc1882cf833cefa6c68f>kubeflow/manifests@0842eb2</denchmark-link> it's not only ones which were updated.

kubeflow@masternode:/nfsroot/kf-poc$ kubectl get pod --all-namespaces|grep -vi Runnin NAMESPACE NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE default your-garfish-prometheus-server-6cc989b798-82vls 1/2 CrashLoopBackOff 16 81m istio-system istio-pilot-67f9bd57b-xzmph 0/2 CrashLoopBackOff 10 81m istio-system istio-policy-749ff546dd-vbq28 1/2 CrashLoopBackOff 26 81m istio-system istio-telemetry-6f6d8db656-8cpd7 1/2 CrashLoopBackOff 26 81m istio-system prometheus-744f885d74-dkbtc 0/1 ContainerCreating 0 81m kubeflow katib-db-576c7f9f49-ftk7g 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 7 11m kubeflow katib-manager-6b4f79fb56-jqnzg 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 7 11m kubeflow metadata-db-5b7c98746-zhdg6 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 17 81m kubeflow metadata-deployment-5dfbf84d69-hcml9 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 17 81m kubeflow metadata-deployment-5dfbf84d69-mffhq 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 17 81m kubeflow metadata-deployment-5dfbf84d69-sxlzq 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 17 81m kubeflow minio-d66d85f96-5fl2p 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 16 81m kubeflow ml-pipeline-64b79d75bd-jpxv2 0/1 Error 8 81m kubeflow ml-pipeline-persistenceagent-6bb55755bf-mv68m 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 12 81m kubeflow seldon-operator-controller-manager-0 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 17 76m kubeflow@masternode:/nfsroot/kf-poc$
in the git downloaded location i see seldondeployments.machinelearning.seldon.io-crd.yaml while in the installed location it is crd.yaml can you please help

I hope kubeflow team will help with solution soon.
You can see the errors are from another deployments katib-suggestion-grid, katib-suggestion-hyperband, katib-suggestion-nasrl, katib-suggestion-random. Now I see from https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/ you apply https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.6.2.yaml which uses repo manifests https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests That's mean that there has to be a new release of kubeflow or so for k8s v1.16 If you need to have it done without waiting try to reinstall kubeflow from source code if you can. You can also try to apply the rest of files from https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/master/katib-v1alpha2/suggestion/base but you can see from kubeflow/manifests@0842eb2 it's not only ones which were updated.

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/uniuuu>@uniuuu</denchmark-link>
is there a way you can get us help for this issue requesting since the kubeflow positioning as mlops tool is stalled at my end can you please advise if there is any other option we can try out? more specifically can you please share the steps to install kubeflow from source code? can we do this on top of existing kubernetes cluster?

You can see the errors are from another deployments katib-suggestion-grid, katib-suggestion-hyperband, katib-suggestion-nasrl, katib-suggestion-random. Now I see from https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/ you apply https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.6.2.yaml which uses repo manifests https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests That's mean that there has to be a new release of kubeflow or so for k8s v1.16 If you need to have it done without waiting try to reinstall kubeflow from source code if you can. You can also try to apply the rest of files from https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/master/katib-v1alpha2/suggestion/base but you can see from kubeflow/manifests@0842eb2 it's not only ones which were updated.
can you please advise which version kubernetes i could try this with and get the PoC moving requesting since as per <denchmark-link:https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6374#issuecomment-539978846>helm/helm#6374 (comment)</denchmark-link>
helm works fine with 1.15.4 but for me kubeflow has been failing since 1.15.3 and 1.16.02

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link> Kubeflow is currently tested on Kubernetes 1.14 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/973fba5a2012e7c9e305092727b2da446a2b6b81/gcp/deployment_manager_configs/cluster-kubeflow.yaml#L36>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/973fba5a2012e7c9e305092727b2da446a2b6b81/gcp/deployment_manager_configs/cluster-kubeflow.yaml#L36</denchmark-link>
It looks like you are hitting a bunch of validation errors with various Kubeflow manifests because of changes in behavior in Kubernetes 1.16. Your best bet is to use Kubernetes 1.14 and to wait until Kubeflow as a whole is updated and tested against 1.16.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4228>#4228</denchmark-link>

@cyrilthank Kubeflow is currently tested on Kubernetes 1.14 https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/973fba5a2012e7c9e305092727b2da446a2b6b81/gcp/deployment_manager_configs/cluster-kubeflow.yaml#L36 It looks like you are hitting a bunch of validation errors with various Kubeflow manifests because of changes in behavior in Kubernetes 1.16. Your best bet is to use Kubernetes 1.14 and to wait until Kubeflow as a whole is updated and tested against 1.16.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link> If you need help installing Kubernetes please open up a new issue of kind question. We will do our best to help you but in general you should look upstream to your kubernetes provider for help with installing/upgrading/downloading Kubernetes. If you are using one of the Cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure, OpenShift) that is working closely with Kubeflow then we can usually provide more help.
